meanings.definition: To remove or cut out (something) from a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: The chef exsects the seeds from the cucumber before slicing it.
meanings.sent2: The dentist exsects the decayed tooth to prevent further damage.
meanings.sent3: The tailor exsects the loose thread from the fabric with precision.
meanings.sent4: The archaeologist exsects the ancient artifact from the excavation site.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon exsects the tumor from the patient's body with care.

meanings.definition: To extract or take out (something) by surgery or dissection.
meanings.sent1: The bee exsects nectar from the flower to bring back to the hive.
meanings.sent2: The scientist exsects a sample of tissue for analysis under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic exsects the damaged part from the engine to replace it.
meanings.sent4: The farmer exsects the ripe fruit from the tree for market sale.
meanings.sent5: The researcher exsects data from various sources to compile the report.
